text.p2: A tropical depression formed Saturday in the Bay of Campeche off Mexico’s southeast coast and is expected to strengthen into a tropical storm over the weekend.

text.p3: The depression was located about 130 miles (210 kilometers) east of Veracruz, Mexico. It had maximum sustained winds of 30 mph (45 kph) and was moving west-northwest at 7 mph (11 kph).

text.p4: A tropical storm warning was issued from Boca de Catan south to Tecolutla.

text.p5: The depression is expected to strengthen into a tropical storm before reaching the coast of Mexico, where it's expected to make landfall Sunday night, according to the National Hurricane Center.

text.p6: Heavy rains are forecast to continue over parts of Guatemala and southeast Mexico for the next few days.

text.p7: 24/7 coverage of breaking news and live events
